publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1907 Fiona McLeod: Lenzie Rugby Club—That the Parliament congratulates Lenzie Rugby Club on its win in the final of the BT Cellnet Bowl at Murrayfield Stadium on Saturday 28 April 2001, a competition open to all club rugby teams in Scotland; commiserates with the opponents, Cartha Queens Park Rugby Club, who are three divisions above Lenzie yet were on the receiving end of the "Lomu Ball" manoeuvre from Ross Queenan and his team-mates, and supports all endeavours to encourage the young people of Scotland to play rugby.

S1M-1907 Fiona McLeod: Lenzie Rugby Club—That the Parliament congratulates Lenzie Rugby Club on its win in the final of the BT Cellnet Bowl at Murrayfield Stadium on Saturday 28 April 2001, a competition open to all club rugby teams in Scotland; commiserates with the opponents, Cartha Queens Park Rugby Club, who are three divisions above Lenzie yet were on the receiving end of the "Lomu Ball" manoeuvre from Ross Queenan and his team-mates, and supports all endeavours to encourage the young people of Scotland to play rugby. Supported by: Mr Alex Salmond*
S1M-1907 Lenzie Rugby Club (lodged on 3 May 2001) Ms Sandra White*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Mr Brian Monteith*
S1M-1907 Lenzie Rugby Club (lodged on 3 May 2001) Irene McGugan*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*
S1M-1907 Lenzie Rugby Club (lodged on 3 May 2001) Mr Gil Paterson*

S1M-1907 Fiona McLeod: Lenzie Rugby Club—That the Parliament congratulates Lenzie Rugby Club on its win in the final of the BT Cellnet Bowl at Murrayfield Stadium on Saturday 28 April 2001, a competition open to all club rugby teams in Scotland; commiserates with the opponents, Cartha Queens Park Rugby Club, who are three divisions above Lenzie yet were on the receiving end of the "Lomu Ball" manoeuvre from Ross Queenan and his team-mates, and supports all endeavours to encourage the young people of Scotland to play rugby. Supported by: Mr Alex Salmond, Ms Sandra White, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mr Brian Monteith, Irene McGugan, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Gil Paterson
S1M-1907 Lenzie Rugby Club (lodged on 3 May 2001) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S1M-1907 Lenzie Rugby Club (lodged on 3 May 2001) Andrew Wilson*, Alex Neil*
S1M-1907 Lenzie Rugby Club (lodged on 3 May 2001) Mrs Margaret Ewing*

Supported by: Mr Alex Salmond, Ms Sandra White, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mr Brian Monteith, Irene McGugan, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Adam Ingram, Andrew Wilson, Alex Neil, Mrs Margaret Ewing
S1M-1907 Lenzie Rugby Club (lodged on 3 May 2001) Elaine Smith*
